definition: commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: English : The general being an official, serve the nation.
sentences.chinese: 將帥是國家重要的輔助者。

sentences.english: We will keep in mind forever of those Marshals and Generals.
sentences.chinese: 我們永遠銘記那些將帥們。

sentences.english: You have made it clear today that the commanders and their men mean nothing to you.
sentences.chinese: 你今日明明地不以將帥，僕人爲念。

sentences.english: Let them say I lived in the time of Hector, tamer of horses.
sentences.chinese: 讓他們說，我活在赫克託時代，一名偉大的將帥。

sentences.english: Tiger sex mighty, often Yu marshals the courage to.
sentences.chinese: 虎性威猛，常喻將帥之勇。

sentences.english: Thus the army adept in warfare may be likened to the snake, Shuai Ran.
sentences.chinese: 所以，善於用兵的將帥，就好像率然一樣。

sentences.english: If the general is not courageous, it is similar to fighting without a general.
sentences.chinese: 如果將帥不能英勇奮戰，就好像沒有將帥一般。

sentences.english: If the general is not courageous, it is similar to fighting without a general.
sentences.chinese: 如果將帥不能英勇奮戰，就好像沒有將帥一般。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
place where the emperor listened to lectures (traditional)
to go on a punitive expedition
Sunwu county in Heihe 黑河[Hei1 he2], Heilongjiang
